description: From Ancient Greek γοργόνειον (gorgóneion), neuter of γοργόνειος (gorgóneios, “pertaining to a Gorgon”).

entries.meaning: A (representation of a) gorgon's head, especially that of Medusa.
examples: Pausanias twice mentions a gilt-bronze aigis with the head of Medousa, or gorgoneion, at its center, placed high on the south wall of the Acropolis above the Theater of Dionysos [Figs. 4, 9].

entries.meaning: (historical, Ancient Greek theatre) A theatrical mask depicting the face of a gorgon.
